Reason: The _monitor configuration option is performance-sensitive. The configuration directly impacts the behavior and size of the PersistentJournal object created in the journal() method. The monitor() method, which is called within the journal() method, sets the monitor for the PersistentJournal object. Depending on the monitor configuration, it can affect the monitoring functionality of the PersistentJournal object, leading to notable performance variations at the system level. Additionally, the creation of the PersistentJournal object with specific parameters based on the _monitor configuration can contribute to time-expensive and memory-expensive operations, further emphasizing its performance sensitivity.
